body:
I have never faced this but maybe it's because I use custom fonts and stuff.
As far as I know thru research, the problem is using google fonts instead try using vercel fonts to check if it at least works from vercel fonts.

`npm install @vercel/fonts`

and then import it like this:
`import { GeistSans, GeistMono } from "@vercel/fonts";`

If this doesn't work and still gives you the same issue, let me know.

Thank you for your reply!

I tried installing @vercel/fonts using:

`npm install @vercel/fonts`

But I got the following error:

```
npm error code E404
npm error 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/@vercel%2ffonts - Not found
npm error 404
npm error 404  '@vercel/fonts@*' is not in this registry.
npm error 404
npm error 404 Note that you can also install from a
npm error 404 tarball, folder, http url, or git url.
```

Instead, I installed geist with:

`npm install geist`

and imported it like this:

`import { GeistSans } from "geist/font/sans";`

This worked without any issues.
Oh, thats amazing. Thanks for letting me know.

FWIW I have just noticed this as well. I am working through the Learn Next tutorial and all of a sudden I am getting a similar error:

```
Error while requesting resource
Received response with status 404 when requesting https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Lusitana:wght@400;700&display=swap

Import trace:
  [next]/internal/font/google/lusitana_2c703b0b.module.css
  [next]/internal/font/google/lusitana_2c703b0b.js
  ./src/app/layout.tsx
```

Yep, same one bug/error.

Did you try installing geist?
`npm install geist`

_Edit by maintainer bot: Comment was **automatically** minimized because it was considered unhelpful. (If you think this was by mistake, let us know). Please only comment if it adds context to the issue. If you want to express that you have the same problem, use the upvote ðŸ‘ on the issue description or subscribe to the issue for updates. Thanks!_

I can't be sure but I think that this issue could be related to google itself because a get a similar issue when working with Flutter. Sometimes it loads the fonts but most of the time it failed with 404

Hi. This is happening to me after upgrading nextjs to 15.4.2. And now my app is using "fallback font" instead of original.
When on 15.3.0 it worked fine. 

```
 âš  [next]/internal/font/google/quicksand_9fb1c9c4.module.css
Error while requesting resource
Received response with status 404 when requesting https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Quicksand:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap

Import trace:
  [next]/internal/font/google/quicksand_9fb1c9c4.module.css
  [next]/internal/font/google/quicksand_9fb1c9c4.js
  ./app/(platform)/layout.tsx


 âš  [next]/internal/font/google/quicksand_9fb1c9c4.module.css
next/font: warning:
Failed to download `Quicksand` from Google Fonts. Using fallback font instead.
```

> I can't be sure but I think that this issue could be related to google itself because a get a similar issue when working with Flutter. Sometimes it loads the fonts but most of the time it failed with 404

In my case, it's not a problem with the fonts. I did this: 

```bash
npm audit fix --force
```

and that upgraded my nextjs version to 15.4.2 and now... the problem with the fonts. minutes before, it was working perefctly.

Yep, it seems like it's the new version. I started having this problem right after updating to `15.4.2`
The last version without the error seems to be `15.4.0`

I get:

> Error while requesting resource
> Received response with status *404* when requesting https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Roboto+Slab:wght@100;200;300;400;500;600;700;800;900&display=swap

But if I click the link, it works fine.

@Willienn 15.4.0 is actually an old canary release of 15.3.x that was published as 15.4.0 by accident when we were testing our release workflows. It is deprecated on npm. We were unable to unpublish it due to npm policies.
Are Intel Macs the common theme here? Are people having trouble on other platforms?

I've managed to reproduce this under Rosetta. I downloaded a macOS x64 "standalone" binary from https://nodejs.org/en/download and then put it in my path before running `pnpm i` or `pnpm dev`:

```
export PATH=/Users/bgw/Downloads/node-v22.17.1-darwin-x64/bin/:"$PATH"
```
This appears to be caused by a rustc miscompilation bug: https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3902

issue.title: Turbopack: Use workaround for rustc miscompilation bug on macos intel
issue.body:
Uses https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/3908 cherry-picked on top of hyper v1.6.0 to work around https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3902 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/140686

- Git Branch: https://github.com/bgw/hyper-rs/commits/v1.6.0-with-macos-intel-miscompilation-workaround/
- Cherry-picked commit: https://github.com/bgw/hyper-rs/commit/ab3544930722e6c270c16d3239dbb1d58f713393

Fixes #81697

The proper fix is to update the rustc toolchain, but since we use nightly toolchains, this is too risky for a minor patch release. So this applies the workaround instead.

## Test Plan

Force using x86-64 under Rosetta by downloading a "standalone" version of nodejs and adding it to the front of the `PATH` with:

```
export PATH=/Users/bgw/Downloads/node-v22.17.1-darwin-x64/bin/:"$PATH"
```

Use `create-next-app` to create a new app. This fetching Geist by default.

Run `pnpm dev`, see the 404 errors.

Modify the `package.json` to use this preview version:

```
    "next": "https://vercel-packages.vercel.app/next/commits/16196a3d2d7df65222727619e8db993336cf7aff/next"
```

Run `pnpm i && pnpm dev`, see that the 404s are solved!

Closes PACK-5117
